message.body: Hi, does someone understand what I wrote about ZeroNet in ZeroBoard? It is important for Chinese users!!
Hi, I talk about a few things there, all listed on ZeroSecurity page.
So, about tor: all tor IPs are in public, so if I'd be the Chin. gov. I can easily block also teh tor IPs, or better: direct you to my "own Tor's" so I can bring vioruses on your pcs
if I own the Tor: I can also decide what I block there or not (e.g. the 8 trackers)

the 2nd issue I talk about is that ZeroBoard is leaking data of the users: it connects to demo.zeronet.com, so if I am the Chinese government I can assuem every chinese user accessing that page is using ZeroNert and bring other things into play
can  you please recommend to all Chinese users this first: http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroblog.bit/?Post:60:protect+yourselves:+set+a+non-working+proxy
e.g. ZeroBoard sends "only" Ip, browser info, but see my comment here:

start with: "If they can transmit IP, then they can transmit also OTHER INFO about you, easily." in: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:8_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf/Our+security+in+ZeroNet
the 2nd advice is: don't click every link people give you. The same rules as in normal internet applies also here
btw: ZeroID also connects to demo.zeronet.com when you registered via web way
@nassau exactly, it is a simple thing to protect. But: doesn't offer full protection.
more stuff about security at: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Zerosecurity.bit
e.g. ZeroBoard uses this in its code:         return $.post("https://demo.zeronet.io/ZeroBoard/add.php", {
so, others can do more harm, by sending more info via this way, when you visit someone's site
and in general site admins can be evil :-( so, first visit only pages of people you know/trust
@swulling about zeroid + zeroverse relationship -> "Why I created ZeroVerse.bit?" http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroverse.bit/why.html
@mx "anyone else from Hangzhou?" <- I am from Germany
@maiowu yes, there is delay in every ZeroNet app, see: http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroblog.bit/?Post:58:queueing+content+%28in+ZeroNet+0.3.6+rev1098%29
@tuzi thank you for: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NzWeweqJ32aRVdM5UzFnYCszuvG5xV3vS/?Topic:17_1M1c7x7SLau8D2bm8Gw8iWQbBqe9X4zqPw/Erkan
a Chinese person asked in ZeroBoard for this: http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroblog.bit/?Post:66:How+to+find+people,+add+friends+
@gt details, of course. what are your questions in specific ?
you can write in Chinese, and I will reply in English
(I am not sure if the online translation is good. others can then translate really into Chinese)
@gt because it sends and receives data from demo.zeronet.com, see source code of ZeroBoard and ZeroID. example from ZeroBoard:
return $.post("https://demo.zeronet.io/ZeroID/request.php", {
return $.post("https://demo.zeronet.io/ZeroID/solution.php", {
I have added what to do in both cases, see S001 + S002 under "specific sites" in: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Zerosecurity.bit
ZeroID:       return $.post("https://demo.zeronet.io/ZeroID/request.php", {
return $.post("https://demo.zeronet.io/ZeroID/solution.php", {
calls same 2 pages
1. If demo.zeronet.com is blocked: a. ZeroBoard posting does not work b. but you can read what others write there
2. zeroid will still work, since the demo.zeronet.com is used for web registration. Afterwards your ID is saved in the ZeroNet data dir.

the problem is this: 1. user is not told about outside access. 2. since Edward Snowden we know that organizations sniff the web, I assume in China this is more aware then here in the Western world (e.g. your own government spying, ...)
ok :-)
@gt the most important AND easy thing to protect yourself is this: http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroblog.bit/?Post:60:protect+yourselves:+set+a+non-working+proxy
@gt I don't know shadowsocks
@gt I see

Permission denied is normally because a user who has not the same rights as the user who created it
so, you could do first this:
type: ls -la /etc/zeronet.conf
you will see who edited/created that file, and probably the app where you see that error message has different rights
